intro: Brickellia rosmarinifolia subsp. chlorolepis, commonly known as the green-leafed brickellia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb characterized by its aromatic, narrow, and often gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or open habitats. Its botanical features make it a notable species in arid and semi-arid regions.
